tasks.title: Setup Development Environment and Project Structure
tasks.description: Initialize the CAP project structure with Node.js and configure the development environment with required dependencies and tools.
tasks.details:
1. Install Node.js ≥20 and npm/yarn
2. Install SAP CAP CLI using `npm i -g @sap/cds-dk`
3. Initialize a new CAP project: `cds init sflight --add hana,mta`
4. Configure package.json with required dependencies:
   - @sap/cds: latest version
   - express: latest version
   - @sap/hana-client: for HANA connectivity
   - typescript: for type-safe development
5. Setup TypeScript configuration (tsconfig.json)
6. Configure Jest for testing with 20-second timeout
7. Create development scripts in package.json:
   - `cds watch` for local development
   - `npm run build:ui` for frontend builds
   - `npm test` for testing
8. Initialize Git repository with appropriate .gitignore
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify all development commands work correctly
2. Ensure project structure follows CAP best practices
3. Validate TypeScript compilation works
4. Test that cds watch starts successfully
5. Verify Jest test runner executes properly

tasks.title: Define Core Data Models and Database Schema
tasks.description: Create the data models for Travel, Booking, BookingSupplement entities and master data with proper relationships and annotations.
tasks.details:
1. Create db/schema.cds file with the following entities:
   - Travel (root entity with UUID/sequential ID)
   - Booking (child entity with flight associations)
   - BookingSupplement (grandchild entity)
   - Master Data: Airlines, Passengers, TravelAgencies, Supplements, Flights, Airports
2. Define compositions between entities:
   - Travel to Booking (1:n)
   - Booking to BookingSupplement (1:n)
3. Add required fields for each entity:
   - Travel: ID, agencyID, customerID, beginDate, endDate, bookingFee, totalPrice, currencyCode, description, status, etc.
   - Booking: ID, travelID, flightDate, flightPrice, connectionID, etc.
   - BookingSupplement: ID, bookingID, supplementID, price, etc.
4. Add annotations for UI rendering and validation
5. Configure SQLite for development database
6. Create sample data in .csv files for initial deployment
7. Implement managed aspects for audit fields (createdAt, createdBy, etc.)
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Validate schema using `cds compile db/schema.cds`
2. Deploy schema to SQLite using `cds deploy`
3. Verify entity relationships through CDS model inspection
4. Test data loading with sample CSV files
5. Validate field constraints and types

subtasks.title: Create Master Data Entities
subtasks.description: Define all master data entities including Airlines, Passengers, TravelAgencies, Supplements, Flights, and Airports with their respective fields.
subtasks.details:
1. Define Airlines entity with ID, name, and other relevant fields
2. Define Passengers entity with ID, name, contact information
3. Define TravelAgencies entity with ID, name, location
4. Define Supplements entity with ID, type, description, price
5. Define Flights entity with carrier, connection, price, date fields
6. Define Airports entity with ID, name, city, country
7. Add appropriate field types and constraints for each entity
<info added on 2025-09-24T17:59:30.578Z>
Implementation completed successfully. All master data entities have been implemented in db/schema.cds with proper structure and annotations:

- Airlines Entity includes AirlineID, Name, CurrencyCode, and Url with appropriate annotations
- Passengers Entity contains CustomerID, name fields, contact information, and complete address structure
- TravelAgencies Entity includes AgencyID, Name, and detailed location/contact information
- Supplements Entity contains SupplementID, Type, Description, and Price with currency support
- Flights Entity includes CarrierID, ConnectionID, FlightDate, Price, and proper association to Airlines
- Airports Entity contains AirportID, Name, City, CountryCode, and geographic data

All entities follow CAP best practices with cuid and managed aspects for UUID keys and audit fields, proper field types with appropriate constraints, @mandatory and @title annotations, and SFLIGHT domain conventions. The schema compiles successfully to SQL with proper referential integrity between entities.

tasks.details:

10. Configure mock authentication for development

tasks.title: Implement Role-Based Authorization and Workflow
tasks.description: Configure the four-tier authorization model and implement approval workflows with status management.
tasks.details:
1. Define role model in xs-security.json:
   - authenticated-user: read-only access
   - reviewer: approval capabilities
   - processor: full operational access
   - admin: system configuration access
2. Implement role checks in service handlers:
   - READ restrictions based on roles
   - UPDATE/DELETE restrictions for processors/admins
   - Approval actions for reviewers
3. Configure status transitions with role validation:
   - Open → Accepted (requires reviewer role)
   - Accepted → Canceled (requires processor role)
4. Implement discount authorization workflow:
   - Add discount fields to Travel entity
   - Create approval process for discounts above threshold
   - Implement notification mechanism for pending approvals
5. Add audit trail through managed entity annotations
6. Configure secure handling of passenger information
7. Implement mock authentication for development
8. Prepare for XSUAA integration in production
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test access control with different user roles
2. Verify status transitions with authorized/unauthorized users
3. Test approval workflow for discounts
4. Validate audit trail captures all changes
5. Test secure handling of passenger information
6. Verify authentication works in development mode
7. Test role-specific UI elements visibility
